detailed_issues.section_text: DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATION

detailed_issues.red_flag: The definition of 'Basic Wage' should be clear and compliant with ADGM regulations. Cross-referencing to clause 6.2 is acceptable if clause 6.2 provides a clear and compliant definition.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Review clause 6.2 to ensure the definition of 'Basic Wage' is compliant and unambiguous. Ensure it excludes allowances unless explicitly stated otherwise.
detailed_issues.section_text: “Basic Wage" shall have the meaning set out in clause 6.2;

detailed_issues.red_flag: No issues found
detailed_issues.suggestion: Document appears compliant
detailed_issues.section_text: "ADGM Employment Regulations" means the ADGM Employment Regulations 2024, as amended;

detailed_issues.red_flag: Definition of "UAE" is standard but may not be necessary in an ADGM contract if the context is clear. Consider if this definition is actually used.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Review the contract to determine if the definition of "UAE" is actually used. If not, remove it for brevity.
detailed_issues.section_text: "UAE" means the United Arab Emirates;

detailed_issues.red_flag: Cross-referencing "Wages" to clause 6.2 is acceptable, but ensure clause 6.2 provides a comprehensive definition of what constitutes "Wages" under ADGM Employment Regulations.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Verify that clause 6.2 clearly defines "Wages" to include all mandatory components as per ADGM regulations (e.g., basic salary, allowances, etc.).
detailed_issues.section_text: "Wages" shall have the meaning set out in clause 6.2;

detailed_issues.red_flag: The statement "The Wages is inclusive of allowances and allocated as follows" is vague. It needs to be more specific about which allowances are included.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Clearly list all allowances included in the total wage and specify how they are allocated. Refer to specific ADGM requirements for mandatory allowances.
detailed_issues.section_text: The Wages is inclusive of allowances and allocated as follows:

detailed_issues.red_flag: The contract uses bracketed placeholders (AED [insert amount]). These must be replaced with actual values before the contract is finalized.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Replace the placeholder with the actual agreed-upon Basic Wage amount.
detailed_issues.section_text: basic wage of AED [insert amount] (the "Basic Wage");

detailed_issues.red_flag: The contract uses bracketed placeholders (AED [insert amount]). These must be replaced with actual values before the contract is finalized.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Replace the placeholder with the actual agreed-upon accommodation allowance amount.
detailed_issues.section_text: accommodation allowance of AED [insert amount]; and

detailed_issues.red_flag: The contract uses bracketed placeholders (AED [insert amount]). These must be replaced with actual values before the contract is finalized.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Replace the placeholder with the actual agreed-upon transportation allowance amount.
detailed_issues.section_text: transportation allowance of AED [insert amount].

detailed_issues.red_flag: The contract uses bracketed placeholders ([insert date of every month]). These must be replaced with actual values before the contract is finalized. Payment method should comply with ADGM regulations.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Replace the placeholder with the specific date of the month for wage payment. Ensure the payment method (bank credit transfer) complies with ADGM regulations regarding wage payment methods.
detailed_issues.section_text: The Wages shall be payable on the [insert date of every month] by [bank credit transfer].

detailed_issues.red_flag: This section is incomplete. It only states "the amount of the Wages payable; and". It needs to specify what action or information is related to the wage amount.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Complete this section with the relevant information or action related to the wage amount. For example, it could be related to deductions, overtime pay, or other relevant clauses.
detailed_issues.section_text: the amount of the Wages payable; and

detailed_issues.red_flag: The section lacks specifics regarding permissible deductions. ADGM regulations require transparency and justification for all deductions.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Specify all permissible deductions (e.g., loan repayments, social security contributions) and the method of calculation. Ensure compliance with ADGM regulations regarding permissible deductions.
detailed_issues.section_text: the amount of and reason for any deductions from the Wages.

detailed_issues.red_flag: The clause gives the Company absolute discretion over vacation leave timing. This could be problematic if unreasonably withheld.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Add language ensuring that vacation requests will not be unreasonably denied and that the Company will consider the employee's preferences. Specify the minimum vacation entitlement as per ADGM regulations.
detailed_issues.section_text: Vacation leave shall be taken at such time or times as may be approved in advance by the Company.

detailed_issues.red_flag: This section is too vague. It needs to specify the employee's and employer's obligations upon termination, including notice periods, final salary payments, and repatriation (if applicable).
detailed_issues.suggestion: Detail the termination process, including notice periods (aligned with ADGM regulations), calculation and payment of final dues (salary, gratuity, accrued leave), and repatriation arrangements (if applicable).
detailed_issues.section_text: On termination of this Contract:

detailed_issues.red_flag: While mentioning statutory maternity leave, the contract should explicitly state the duration and pay in accordance with ADGM Employment Regulations.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Specify the duration of maternity leave (as per ADGM regulations) and the percentage of salary to be paid during the leave period. Clarify eligibility criteria.
detailed_issues.section_text: statutory maternity leave (including adoption) and maternity pay; or

detailed_issues.red_flag: Similar to maternity leave, the contract should explicitly state the duration and pay for paternity leave in accordance with ADGM Employment Regulations.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Specify the duration of paternity leave (as per ADGM regulations) and the percentage of salary to be paid during the leave period. Clarify eligibility criteria.
detailed_issues.section_text: statutory paternity leave (including adoption) and paternity pay; and

detailed_issues.red_flag: While confidentiality clauses are standard, ensure the scope is reasonable and doesn't unduly restrict the employee's future employment opportunities. The clause should also comply with ADGM data protection regulations.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Review the scope of the confidentiality clause to ensure it is reasonable and necessary to protect legitimate business interests. Ensure compliance with ADGM data protection regulations regarding employee data.
detailed_issues.section_text: CONFIDENTIALITY/NON-DISCLOSURE

detailed_issues.red_flag: This clause, allowing the company to require the employee not to attend work during the notice period, is acceptable but should clarify whether the employee will continue to receive full pay during this period (garden leave).
detailed_issues.law_citation: N/A - Common practice, but should be clearly defined
detailed_issues.suggestion: Explicitly state that the employee will receive full pay and benefits during any period of 'garden leave' imposed by the Company.
detailed_issues.section_text: The Company may require the Employee not to attend work during any period of such notice.

detailed_issues.red_flag: This section is too broad. It needs to specify the grounds for immediate termination, ensuring they align with ADGM Employment Regulations regarding gross misconduct or other justifiable reasons. Unjustified immediate termination could lead to legal challenges.
detailed_issues.suggestion: List specific and justifiable reasons for immediate termination, such as gross misconduct, breach of contract, or other reasons permitted under ADGM Employment Regulations. Ensure due process is followed before immediate termination.
detailed_issues.section_text: The Company may terminate the employment under this Contract with immediate effect:

detailed_issues.red_flag: The phrase 'for cause if the Employee is under a probationary period' is vague. The definition of 'cause' needs to be clearly defined and aligned with ADGM Employment Regulations. Probationary periods also have specific limitations under ADGM law.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Employment Regulations 2019, specifically regarding termination and probationary periods.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Define 'cause' explicitly within the contract, referencing specific performance or conduct issues. Ensure the probationary period adheres to ADGM regulations regarding duration and termination rights.
detailed_issues.section_text: for cause if the Employee is under a probationary period as set out in clause 4.

detailed_issues.red_flag: This section is incomplete. It states 'On termination of the employment under this Contract, the Employee shall:' but doesn't specify what the employee is required to do. This lack of detail creates ambiguity and potential for disputes.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Employment Regulations 2019, regarding termination procedures and employee obligations.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Specify the employee's obligations upon termination, such as returning company property, handing over information, and cooperating with the transition.
detailed_issues.section_text: On termination of the employment under this Contract, the Employee shall:

detailed_issues.red_flag: The clause 'not at any time represent himself to be connected with the Company' is overly broad and potentially unenforceable. It lacks specific context and time limitations.
detailed_issues.law_citation: General principles of contract law regarding reasonableness and enforceability of restrictive covenants.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Clarify the scope and duration of this restriction. Consider specifying the types of representations that are prohibited and limiting the restriction to a reasonable period after termination.
detailed_issues.section_text: not at any time represent himself to be connected with the Company.

detailed_issues.red_flag: This section refers to Clause 18.1 without providing any context about what Clause 18.1 covers. This makes it impossible to assess the implications of this exception.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Provide the full text or a summary of Clause 18.1 to understand the implications of this exception. Ensure Clause 18.1 itself is compliant with ADGM regulations.
detailed_issues.section_text: Clause 18.1 will not apply if the Employee:

detailed_issues.red_flag: This section refers to Clause 16.2(a) regarding termination for cause, but without the context of Clause 16.2(a), it's impossible to determine if the termination process aligns with ADGM regulations. The definition of 'cause' is also critical here.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Employment Regulations 2019, regarding termination procedures and acceptable grounds for termination.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Provide the full text or a summary of Clause 16.2(a). Ensure the definition of 'cause' and the termination process comply with ADGM regulations, including notice periods and due process.
detailed_issues.section_text: has been terminated by the Company for cause in accordance with clause 16.2(a) of this Contract.

detailed_issues.red_flag: The title 'SCHEDULE A – SUMMARY OF EMPLOYMENT TERMS' is generic. The schedule itself needs to contain all mandatory employment terms as required by ADGM law, such as salary, working hours, leave entitlements, and other benefits.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Employment Regulations 2019, regarding mandatory employment terms that must be included in the contract.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Ensure Schedule A includes all mandatory employment terms as specified by ADGM regulations. Review the schedule for completeness and accuracy.
detailed_issues.section_text: SCHEDULE A – SUMMARY OF EMPLOYMENT TERMS

detailed_issues.red_flag: Table 2 only includes basic information (Company Name, Employee's Name, Date of Birth). It lacks crucial details required for identification and record-keeping, such as employee ID, job title, and contact information.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Data Protection Regulations and general principles of record-keeping.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Expand Table 2 to include all necessary employee information, such as employee ID, job title, contact details, and emergency contact information. Ensure compliance with ADGM Data Protection Regulations when handling personal data.
detailed_issues.section_text: Table 2: 1. | Company Name | ; 2. | Employee’s Name | ; 3. | Date of Birth |

detailed_issues.red_flag: The disclaimer states that the contract sets out the *minimum* employment standards applicable in ADGM pursuant to ADGM Employment Regulations of 2024, which may be amended from time to time without notification. This could be interpreted as non-binding language, as it only refers to minimum standards and implies changes may occur without notice.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Rephrase to confirm that the contract fully complies with current ADGM Employment Regulations and that any amendments will be formally documented and communicated.
detailed_issues.compliant_clause: This Employment Contract fully complies with the ADGM Employment Regulations of 2024 as of the effective date. Any amendments to these regulations that affect the terms of this contract will be formally documented and communicated to the Employee.

recommendations: Immediate action required: Prepare critical missing documents
Important documents missing: Plan to prepare within 2-3 business days
next_steps: Focus on preparing Articles of Association and Memorandum of Association first
Schedule board/shareholder meetings for required resolutions
combination_issues: Single employment document detected - consider adding Employee Handbook or Employment Policy
